intro: Arisaema papillosum, commonly known as the crested arisaema, is a herbaceous plant native to the forests of China. It belongs to the Araceae family, characterized by its distinctive inflorescence consisting of a spadix surrounded by a spathe. The plant features a short rhizome with a cluster of fleshy, tuberous roots that store nutrients. Its leaves are typically arrow-shaped and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Arisaema papillosum is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
